translated: Because form is essenceless, the bodhisattva is not apprehended in the future.🔽Because form is nonexistent, the bodhisattva is not apprehended in the middle.

original: gzugs stong pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' dbus su mi dmigs so //🔽gzugs dben pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dbus su mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs stong pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' dbus su mi dmigs so // gzugs dben pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dbus su mi dmigs so //
translated: Because form is empty, the bodhisattva is not apprehended in the middle.🔽Because form is isolated, the bodhisattva is not apprehended in the middle.

original: gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dbus su mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dbus su mi dmigs so //
translated: Because form is essenceless, the bodhisattva is not apprehended in the middle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽the emptiness of form, the isolation of form, and the absence of intrinsic nature in form are not the bodhisattva.

original: gzugs med pa dang / gzugs stong pa nyid dang / gzugs dben pa dang / gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa la sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs /🔽phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang / gzugs stong pa nyid dang / gzugs dben pa dang / gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa la sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs / phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs /
translated: The emptiness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, the isolation of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, and the absence of intrinsic nature in feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not the bodhisattva.

original: dbus mi dmigs te /
analyzed: dbus mi dmigs te /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzugs med pa'ang gzhan ma yin /🔽gzugs stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'ang gzhan ma yin / gzugs stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin /
translated: the emptiness of the eyes, the isolation of the eyes, and the absence of intrinsic nature in the eyes are not the bodhisattva.

original: gzugs dben pa'ang gzhan ma yin /🔽gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa'ang gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs dben pa'ang gzhan ma yin / gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa'ang gzhan ma yin /
translated: The emptiness of the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind, the isolation of the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind, and the absence of intrinsic nature in the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are not the bodhisattva.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽the emptiness of sights, the isolation of sights, and the absence of intrinsic nature in sights are not the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan ma yin /🔽sngon gyi mtha' yang gzhan ma yin /🔽phyi ma'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan ma yin / sngon gyi mtha' yang gzhan ma yin / phyi ma'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin /
translated: The emptiness of sounds, odors, tastes, tangibles, and mental phenomena, the isolation of sounds, odors, tastes, tangibles, and mental phenomena, and the absence of intrinsic nature in sounds, odors, tastes, tangibles, and mental phenomena are not the bodhisattva.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: dbus kyang gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: dbus kyang gzhan ma yin no //
translated: the emptiness of the sensory element of the eyes, the isolation of the sensory element of the eyes, and the absence of intrinsic nature in the sensory element of the eyes are not the bodhisattva.🔽The emptiness of the sensory element of sights, the isolation of the sensory element of sights, and the absence of intrinsic nature in the sensory element of sights are not the bodhisattva.🔽The emptiness of the sensory element of eye consciousness, the isolation of the sensory element of eye consciousness, and the absence of intrinsic nature in the sensory element of eye consciousness are not the bodhisattva.🔽In the same way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: the emptiness of the sensory element of the ears, the sensory element of sounds, and the sensory element of ear consciousness,🔽the sensory element of the nose, the sensory element of odors, and the sensory element of nose consciousness,🔽the sensory element of the tongue, the sensory element of tastes, and the sensory element of tongue consciousness,🔽the sensory element of the body, the sensory element of tangibles, and the sensory element of body consciousness,

original: de ltar na gzugs med pa gang yin pa dang / gzugs stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / gzugs dben pa gang yin pa dang / gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs med pa gang yin pa dang / gzugs stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / gzugs dben pa gang yin pa dang / gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' gang yin pa dang /
translated: Thus, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the formless, the emptiness of form, the isolation of form, the naturelessness of form, the bodhisattva, the prior limit,

original: phyi ma'i mtha' gang yin @476b pa dang / dbus gang yin pa de thams cad kyang gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' gang yin @476b pa dang / dbus gang yin pa de thams cad kyang gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: the later limit, and the middle—all of these are not two, nor are they divided.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

analyzed: sgra med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so //

analyzed: sgra stong pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so // sgra dben pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so //

analyzed: sgra ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so //

analyzed: sgra med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' phyi ma'i mthar mi dmigs so // sgra stong pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' phyi ma'i mthar mi dmigs so //
translated: because sound is non-existent, the bodhisattva cannot be found at the end of the end.🔽because the emptiness of sound is not the emptiness of sound, the bodhisattva cannot be found at the end of the end.

analyzed: sgra dben pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' phyi ma'i mthar mi dmigs so //

analyzed: sgra ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' phyi ma'i mthar mi dmigs so //

analyzed: sgra med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dbus su mi dmigs so // sgra stong pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' dbus su mi dmigs so //

analyzed: sgra dben pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dbus su mi dmigs so //

analyzed: sgra ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dbus su mi dmigs so // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: because sound is essentially non-apprehensible, the bodhisattva cannot be found in the middle.🔽If you ask why, Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /

analyzed: sgra med pa dang / sgra stong pa nyid dang / sgra dben pa dang / sgra ngo bo nyid med pa la sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs /

analyzed: sgra med pa'ang gzhan ma yin / @477a *// sgra stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan ma yin / sngon gyi mtha' yang gzhan ma yin /

analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin /

analyzed: dbus kyang gzhan ma yin no //

analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' gang yin pa dang / dbus gang yin pa de thams cad kyang gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /

translated: and the absence of an intrinsic nature of ear-contact is not another.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan ma yin /🔽sngon gyi mtha' yang gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan ma yin / sngon gyi mtha' yang gzhan ma yin /
translated: A bodhisattva is not one thing,🔽the past is not another,

original: phyi ma'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin /
translated: the future is not another,

original: dbus kyang gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: dbus kyang gzhan ma yin no //
translated: and the present is not another.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ltar na rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa med @487b pa gang yin pa dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dben pa gang yin pa dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa med @487b pa gang yin pa dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dben pa gang yin pa dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: Therefore, since the nonexistence of ear contact, the emptiness of ear contact, the isolation of ear contact, and the absence of an essence of ear contact are all not two nor divided, therefore, Anantavyūha, the bodhisattvas should train in the nonexistence of ear contact, the emptiness of ear contact, the isolation of ear contact, and the absence of an essence of ear contact.🔽In the same way, Anantavyūha, the bodhisattvas should train in the nonexistence of nose contact, the emptiness of nose contact, the isolation of nose contact, and the absence of an essence of nose contact.🔽Anantavyūha, the bodhisattvas should train in the nonexistence of nose contact, the emptiness of nose contact, the isolation of nose contact, and the absence of an essence of nose contact.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' gang yin pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' gang yin pa dang / dbus gang yin pa de thams cad kyang gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽sna'i 'dus te reg pa med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' gang yin pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' gang yin pa dang / dbus gang yin pa de thams cad kyang gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / sna'i 'dus te reg pa med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so //
translated: Anantavyūha, the bodhisattvas should train in the nonexistence of tongue contact, the emptiness of tongue contact, the isolation of tongue contact, and the absence of an essence of tongue contact.🔽Anantavyūha, the bodhisattvas should train in the nonexistence of body contact, the emptiness of body contact, the isolation of body contact, and the absence of an essence of body contact.🔽Anantavyūha, the bodhisattvas should train in the nonexistence of mind contact, the emptiness of mind contact, the isolation of mind contact, and the absence of an essence of mind contact.🔽Anantavyūha, the bodhisattvas should train in the nonexistence of the sensory element of the eyes, the emptiness of the sensory element of the eyes, the isolation of the sensory element of the eyes, and the absence of an essence of the sensory element of the eyes.🔽Anantavyūha, the bodhisattvas should train in the nonexistence of the sensory element of sights, the emptiness of the sensory element of sights, the isolation of the sensory element of sights, and the absence of an essence of the sensory element of sights.🔽Anantavyūha, the bodhisattvas should train in the nonexistence of the sensory element of visual consciousness, the emptiness of the sensory element of visual consciousness, the isolation of the sensory element of visual consciousness, and the absence of an essence of the sensory element of visual consciousness.

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so //
translated: Anantavyūha, the bodhisattvas should train in the nonexistence of the sensory element of the ears, the emptiness

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa dben pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa dben pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so //
translated: Because the nose-contact is void, the Bodhisattva is not apprehended in the past.

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so //

analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' phyi ma'i mthar mi dmigs so // sna'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' phyi ma'i mthar mi dmigs so //

translated: Because the feeling that arises from the condition of the union of nose and smell is essentially nonexistent, the bodhisattva is not apprehended in the middle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
